channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Europe's Economy Faces Sink-or-Swim Moment as Trump Returns
item.description: With the U.S. election result and the German government’s collapse, the lagging European economy is at a crossroads.

item.title: I inherited $200,000. One of my daughters is married with kids, but the other has debts. Do I split my windfall 50/50?
item.description: “She has incurred a lot of debt due to the financial strain of a sick pet, a car loan, student loans and an unpaid military home loan.”

item.title: ‘I’m a mother in turmoil’: My daughter refuses to see me — and she won’t let me see my grandchild. Should I cut her out of our will?
item.description: “Our family trust is a couple of decades old and needs revision.”

item.title: For What Comes Next in Markets, Look Back to 2016
item.description: Selecting which Trump trades turn into Trump investments is just as difficult this time around as it was in his first term. The right bets might seem ...

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.5% to 99.46
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was up 0.5% to 99.46 — up for two of the past three trading days.

item.title: Homeowners' Dues Are Rising---and Harder to Avoid
item.description: Rising costs for insurance, repair and maintenance are pushing HOA dues higher, often at a faster pace than overall inflation.

item.title: I’m 67, married and have two mortgages worth $660,000. Should I use my 401(k) to pay them off?
item.description: “I want to have $6,000 a month in cash to live comfortably and travel upon retirement.”

item.title: The Score: Warner Bros. Discovery, JPMorgan Chase, Sony and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: What a second Trump term means for Social Security, Medicare and affordable housing
item.description: Congress may have more impact than the president when it comes to retirement.

item.title: Flaws of the Medicare Advantage ‘quality’ ratings exposed in insurance-company lawsuits
item.description: Lawsuits raise questions about the validity of the star ratings system.
